cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stainless steels are resistant to oxidation due to their alloy content.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject material exhibits resistance to the specified corrosion or degradation mechanism under certain conditions.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stainless steels are resistant to sulfidation due to their alloy content.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject material exhibits resistance to the specified corrosion or degradation mechanism under certain conditions.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stainless steels resist various forms of general corrosion, beyond just oxidation and sulfidation, depending on alloy content.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject material exhibits resistance to the specified corrosion or degradation mechanism under certain conditions.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Scope: other forms of corrosion beyond oxidation and sulfidation

remarks: Relation generalized from phrase 'other forms of corrosion' to entity 'general corrosion'.
Relation generalized from phrase 'other forms of corrosion' to entity 'general corrosion'.

The object entity 'general corrosion' is currently assigned the class label 'Oxidation and Sulfidation Corrosion Mechanisms'. This may indicate an upstream entity classification or labeling issue, since general corrosion is broader than oxidation and sulfidation specifically.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Chromium, as an alloying element in stainless steels, contributes to resistance against oxidation.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically an alloying element or component) causally contributes to the resistance of a material system against a specified corrosion or degradation mechanism.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when present as alloying element in stainless steels
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Context: chromium in stainless steel alloy matrix

remarks: Resistance is mediated via stainless steels; not direct chromium surface behavior, but captured as a causal contribution.
Resistance is mediated via stainless steels; not direct chromium surface behavior, but captured as a causal contribution.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Chromium, as an alloying element in stainless steels, contributes to resistance against sulfidation.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically an alloying element or component) causally contributes to the resistance of a material system against a specified corrosion or degradation mechanism.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when present as alloying element in stainless steels
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Context: chromium in stainless steel alloy matrix

remarks: Again, resistance is via its role in stainless steels rather than isolated chromium behavior.
Again, resistance is via its role in stainless steels rather than isolated chromium behavior.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Chromium contributes to resistance to general corrosion forms when used as an alloying element in stainless steels.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject (typically an alloying element or component) causally contributes to the resistance of a material system against a specified corrosion or degradation mechanism.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: when present as alloying element in stainless steels; depending on the alloy content
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Scope: general corrosion (other forms of corrosion)

remarks: Relation created mainly to capture that chromium helps overall corrosion resistance; semantics slightly generalized.
Relation created mainly to capture that chromium helps overall corrosion resistance; semantics slightly generalized.

The object entity 'general corrosion' is currently assigned the class label 'Oxidation and Sulfidation Corrosion Mechanisms'. This may indicate an upstream entity classification or labeling issue, since general corrosion is broader than oxidation and sulfidation specifically.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Adding approximately 0.7% chromium to low alloy C-Mo steels eliminates graphitization.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject inhibits or effectively eliminates the occurrence of the specified degradation or metallurgical process under the stated conditions.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: addition of about 0.7% chromium; steels with up to 1% Mo

remarks: Material context (low alloy C-Mo steels with up to 1% Mo) added as qualifiers rather than as extra entities.
Material context (low alloy C-Mo steels with up to 1% Mo) added as qualifiers rather than as extra entities.

args.remark: The object entity 'general corrosion' is currently assigned the class label 'Oxidation and Sulfidation Corrosion Mechanisms'. This may indicate an upstream entity classification or labeling issue, since general corrosion is broader than oxidation and sulfidation specifically.
args.justification: The relation schema (canonical_rel_name, rel_cls, rel_cls_group) is consistent, but the object_class_label appears semantically narrower than the entity name 'general corrosion'.
